H0.text: Queen Joan of Navarre, who was imprisoned for witchcraft, was the stepmother of which English monarch. Henry IV

H1.text: Queen Joan of Navarre, who was imprisoned for witchcraft, was the stepmother of which English monarch. Richard II

H2.text: Queen Joan of Navarre, who was imprisoned for witchcraft, was the stepmother of which English monarch. Edward III

H3.text: Queen Joan of Navarre, who was imprisoned for witchcraft, was the stepmother of which English monarch. Henry 5

A4.text: Joan of Navarre, Queen of England (1370â€“1437), daughter of Charles II of Navarre and wife of Henry IV of England

A5.text: She was the wife of Henry IV of England.

A6.text: Henry IV had six children from his first marriage to Mary de Bohun, while his second marriage to Joan of Navarre produced no surviving children.

A7.text: On 7 February 1403, nine years after the death of his first wife, Henry married Joan, the daughter of Charles II of Navarre, at Winchester.
